text:
Horrible!! The cook stationed at the Mongolian station is so unprofessional his service is below 1 star the dish automatically comes with noodles but because he doesn't offer it you won't get it...defeats the purpose of Mongolian food also food poisoning alert! Suffering from it as I type. The food is super sketchy eat at your own risk!


Keep in mind I am a stickler for bargains if I can get them in any way I will but  just because you are a dive casino does not mean your service and hygiene should be bad!
Next time you order a drink and it comes in a glass.  Ask to have it put in a Styrofoam cup. A cocktail waitress brought me a drink with lipstick still on the glass {gross}.
Ok- we took a chance on this buffet, and was disappointed.  The only positive experience was with the host staff, who were really nice.

We normally like coming here to play, so when we decided to come and eat, we were disappointed that the buffet was open at 9 for Sunday brunch (we noticed there was man waiting in line and we had to ask him about the wait). On the Station Casino app, it says that it opens at 8:00 am. So I called shortly after (while we were driving to the next place to eat, with our super hungry and grumpy four year old) trying to be helpful and just let them know that the app states the 8:00 am time for opening on Sunday. The lady on the phone let me know that, "Fiesta Henderson opens at 8, unfortunately Rancho opens at 9." I kindly said that they should probably clarify that information, and she unenthusiastically says, "okay," basically acknowledging what I said but we knew she wasn't going to say anything to anyone. So disappointing...we like Garduno's enough, but you won't get our business like you used to.

My 2 stars are generous.

I didnt go here to gamble. And I doubt I will ever go back! 

The rooms are small, but comfortable and cozy. The hand soap and shampoo is actually the best thing about the place! So much so, that I pocketed all I could in my 3 days there. 
Hotel is divided from the casino, have to use your room key to get in, which made me feel safe staying there with my kids. 
Poor selection of channels.
Hidden security deposit that NO ONE MENTIONED when booking, nor was it anywhere to be found on the online reservations page. No bellhop, had to force them to help me with my 8 suitcases upon checkout. But I tipped the guy who got stuck with the job. 

If you are single, like to gamble, and have wheels to get around Vegas, you  could do worse. But you could do a whole lot better too.

We visited for a few hours on a weekday afternoon,  as a diversion from your typical strip casino. First observations: Convenient parking and the place was not smokey at all. Bingo staff were exceptionally helpful and clear, too. A fun place to visit, overall.

The absolute worst experience I have ever had staying at a hotel. It would've been better sleeping the night in my car. This was a last minute booming with a late check in because everything else was sold out. No one at the front desk when checking in. Had to call security to get someone to help us. Made reservations for a king room, when checked in all they had was s double double. The room was 3rd grade at best. The sheets were wrinkled and yellowish. The walls was brink with peeling paint. The carpet looked like it was installed 20 years ago. Some guy playing loud rap music in the parking lot. Despite several calls to the front desk, the wifi, included in the hotel fees never worked. Maybe slept a total of two hours and couldn't wait to get the heck out of there. As stated earlier, if you are in a jam, better to sleep in your car than this dump of a hotel. Would not recommend it to anyone.

If you value your safety, DON'T stay here. No. Seriously. If you want to unwillingly share your belongings, then feel free. Otherwise, read this:

We're locals, but for the last couple of years we've been living in HB. We often have to go back to take care of our house, but if it's a short trip like over a weekend to do maintenance, we usually stay at a hotel rather than have the utilities turned on and off. We prefer to stay at Aliante because of distance, but they were booked, so we opted to spend one night at the Fiesta Rancho. BIG MISTAKE.

The first thing you notice when you walk in is that there are two types of people in the casino: Zombie seniors who never take their eyes off the slot machines, even when they pick up their free drinks or smoke while pumping quarters in and pushing buttons. The other are flat out dangerous gangbangers. That's it. If you have to go out to your vehicle to get something, you had better be armed, and it isn't against the senior citizens.

We checked in & had a room with a "pool view" on the first floor. BTW, that's not a pool, that's a cement pond. I wouldn't put my feet in it for fear of an infection that would drive away all mankind. 

The entire place smells like they are trying to use a massive amount of toilet cleaner to cover the smell of about 300 campsite outhouses that have been used by 600 Boy Scouts at their annual Jamboree where they'd just sampled their first Mexican/Indian/Thai/Curry with extra Brussels Sprout fusion dishes in an all-you-can eat stinkfest buffet. I wanted to gag.

The walls of the rooms are literally made up of painted cinder blocks like you see on those prison shows. Honestly, the room isn't much better than a prison cell. 

The first thing that happened was my youngest daughter, who always takes her shoes off when entering a room, stepped on an exposed tack strip and it punctured her foot. When I complained, they couldn't care less. All they asked was whether I wanted to fill out a security report. Are you kidding me? Send MAINTENANCE and FIX IT! Nope. 

I should mention, we stayed on a Sunday night, not exactly a hotbed of activity anywhere else in LV. On the other hand, at the Fiesta, every night is a hotbed of activity because the gangbangers can just wander up Carey Ave. and Hey! If they don't have the bus money to get back to MLK, they'll just rob you to get it. But if you have a cell phone on you, they'll take that, too. In that case, you're one of the lucky ones.  If you're one of those unlucky senior zombies, they will take your dentures, which apparently almost any pawn shop in town will cash in for a bus token, as long as the gangbangers paint one tooth gold. 

The shower is made for someone 4'11" and shorter, and I am SHORT, so plan on taking a bath/shower, which means you're going to be sitting in the bath while the shower head blasts down on you. About every 14 seconds, the water will turn scalding, so schedule your bath/showers accordingly. Jump in. Batman roll out! Wash hair in 12 seconds. Jump out! Breathe. Jump in. Wash your body in 12 seconds. Jump out! Just hope you don't have to shave your legs. Otherwise, there's a good chance you won't have any skin left from which to shave any stubble. Forget shaving your arms. I'm pretty sure, if you're as careful as I am not to cut the armpits for fear of any sweat later causing you horrible pain, you'd wish you were in Mexico drinking the local water while taking a laxative instead of showering here.  

On the other hand, considering the housekeeping, I wouldn't even suggest you sit on the toilet without Clorox Wipes under you. Sure, your a** gets a bleach burn, but it's better than the Gunga you will probably catch from either the toilet seat or the bathtub. For this stay, just soak a towel in bleach, carry it around with you, and use it to step on, bathe on, sit on, sleep on, and wash your hands, face, teeth, eyeballs! Pretty much, by the time you get out of there, if your skin wasn't that white before, it will be when you leave. Or, you know, you may have caught something you don't want to bring home to your wife/husband or kids.    

And let's talk about the water closet. Not a bathroom. Do yourself a favor, and just go ahead and give up wiping yourself while you're a guest here. I am 5'3" and weigh 95 pounds so I can't imagine how much of your hand will be immersed in the toilet water just to wipe if you're bigger. The toilet is made for children, which strangely at first, made me feel tall when my knees were way above my hips. I'm happy when my feet touch the ground when I am sitting on an adult chair, so if you don't have this short-person problem, holy crap! Don't go to the bathroom here. Bring a wok. You would be better off! You can do all your business right there in the wok, toss it in the hallway, and no one would know the difference with the stink of all those Boy Scouts eating their stinky buffet and the 7000 pounds of toilet cleaner they use...everywhere!

I'm not very pleased how this buffet is charging more for a dinner buffet. the price for 1 person used to be $10.26 and now they want $10.81??? The buffet isn't even BIG enough ! This maybe be my last time coming here.

Excellent price, clean rooms, nice bed, friendly staff.  Super smoky, but hey, guess that's expected in Vegas.  LOVED their restaurant, can't recall the name but it was Mexican and had an awesome atmosphere and great food!  For a $25.00 room, I was very impressed.

I hate this place. Came here for our honeymoon, and was repeatedly disappointed. Problems started as soon as we checked in. We ordered in advance a King size bed room in the smoking section and got a 2 queen size bed room in the non smoking section. They ended up moving us but because of this we didn't get a paper with the room key number on it and got lost. after waiting nearly an hour in the reception I got a bad attitude from the girl at the counter and had to jump through 100 hoops just to get it. The room kept fluctuating between SUPER hot and SUPER cold through no control of our own, the Channel selection was VERY limited (no cartoons, and no comedy central but 5 news channels)  on the television. The walls were paper thin and the hallways REEKED of marijuana. Housekeeping was very loud and took our do no disturb sign twice. No toiletries were offered but a crusty towel and a small bar of soap, there was no coffee maker and 2 cups. Dining options were limited, and the only real restaurant they had was a Denny's We will give the Denny's a different review (YUCK!). Check out went smoothly, was assured we would be charged no more and we were assured we would not be charged any further and receive our deposit in no more than 72 hours but they charged us an additional 32 dollars that was never explained and we had to wait 5 days to get our deposit back. I would have given this place NO stars if the site would let me.

Holy hell yall... I am a HUGE fan of stations. In fact when I worked for them they deserved theyre Fortune 500 rating for one of the best employers. But, this place was a dump. With all the financial hardships they are currently going through I can totally understand with this kinda dead weight. The security was SLOPPY! He was a nice guy, but the uniform material was unpressed and hung sloppy. The armed officer looked like barney fife outta mayberry withh is duty belt slung low. Then the woman at the Amigo cards desk totally blew me away and its times like that they should be lucky my wife has a tight chain on me. First of all I didnt know that kids even toddlers have been banned from the casino floor unless they are on the platform of an eatery. So, when Im standing 10 feet away from my wife waiting for her to get the amigo card the woman at the desk was like you HAVE TO stand at McDonalds you cannot be here with anyone under 21. Im like WTF? Shes 2, what the hell do you have to worry about???? and in a STROLLER! What is she gonna slap a waitress on the ass order a jack a coke, take a drag off a found cigarette butt and pop in her bus money and take a chance on the reels like some honky? No! Was she screaming? NO! Did she scream when I had to take her away from my wife? YES! Stupid fucking laws, you know why casinos are loosing money? Because they are overly dependent on Dincs  (double income no children), retirees and transients! WAKE THE FUCK UP VEGAS! If a casino is connected to a hotel, an attraction (like the ice rink outback), a movie theater, bowling alley etc.. then HELLO! Your gonna have families and kids! If you are harassing my two year old because you cant control the hood rats then find the revenue to pay for COMPOTENT security not barney fife! Ive done casino security for years and Im damn good at it. Never had an insurance liability issue in all the years Ive worked in a casino. So this new anti family laws are bullshit and its why your loosing money. Because of how poorly you treated us and how my daughter was made to feel like a prisoner having to be only on the tiled areas, keeping a family SEPERATED while one takes care of player card stuff and check cashing we cant be together? Thats fucking stupid. Bring on the state tax cause if this is how you treat paying LOCAL customers who would have ate theyre had it not been for your poor staff and nazi like regime then I can totally see why LOCAL casinos are going belly up! Sad sad state of affairs. Bottom line, I understand casinos are not a childrens play place and that some people cant control theyre hellions. HOWEVER I have better service at the Klondike off sunset and its PURELY a gamblers place, no ice rink or hotel so no reason for kids to be theyre but when we go for breakfast they have never treated us harshly or cruely like Fiestas employees. And the Fiesta has a frigging ice rink, so hello you have an attraction that is susposed to attract families and your being total pricks to families? I can totally see why it was a ghost town in there!

ok well turns out this place isnt as bas as i heard... its not dirty or anything at all. i had an great stay here. rooms are seperate from the casino and u need your hotel card to access that side , so its pretty secure. the hidden fee is $11  a day for bull crap newspaper and i dont know what else. but they had their own firework show on 4th of july and it was awsome. i will deff stay here again. it was verry affordable. i paid $98 for a 2 night stay. cant beat that
Great locals joint with nice restaurants, awesome music venues(2) and cheap gambling. Drive through Race and Sports Book! Bring the kids to one of the only ice arenas in the city.

I'm currently staying at this hotel.  I'm paying $48/night, so maybe I shouldn't complain, but this place is so god-awful that I can't help it.  My hotel room is decent.  Everything is fairly clean and comfortable.  The casino itself is full of low-life people.  I tried to watch a football game earlier tonight in their pathetic little sportsbook and had to put up with drunk thugs who were screaming racist and homophobic slurs because the game wasn't going their way.  The average age of the people who come to this casino is probably in the 50s, and most of them look like they can't really afford to be gambling away their money in the first place.  This hotel is several miles away from the main Las Vegas Strip, and it's in a disgusting part of town.  I think I passed three thrift stores once I got off the freeway.  My hotel window overlooks the back part of a Wal-Mart.  

If all you need is a clean place to sleep and shower, this place will work for you.  If you're on vacation, pay a few dollars more and stay at a better place.

I only care about the ice skating rink, other than, don't care about the hotel-casino. It's as ghetto as the hotel-casinos in downtown!

As for the ice arena, it's pretty awesome! Well i never ice skated in my whole life, not until my first skating experience took place in here. It's not as big as you think it would be. There are 50 cent lockers you can rent to put your stuffs in. Rental of shoes are included in the entrance fee which is $9.50 per person. And speaking of the shoes, holy moly, i think they never clean the shoes every after use, unlike when you rent bowling shoes (they spray deodorizer). They are stinky and wet! Ugh so gross! That was my only concern on my last visit. Other than that, i sure did have fun!

Ok it's cheap. That's the best part. The rooms are dated but clean. The staff was vary friendly. I was there for the Armed Services Hockey Tournament so it was vary covenant to have the rink right there. The food is ok at best. The drinks are cheap. The tables games. Well there were not a lot. And most were closed. I think when I come back next year I will stay across the street. Best part was it was a short walk for games. The whole place is incredibly smokey..

It's not the greatest place on Earth but for $15.00 per night I will not be complaining. I got a very comfy room. Beds were great, pillows better than Palazzo. I don't care if I did not get a panoramic view of the strip from my bathtub or a foozeball or pool table, no leather couches, no free room service, no free all I can drink booze, no free anything. But for the price I hardly noticed. The a/c was awesome, the tv had lots of channels, and we had a view of the city. Being that I am from Las Vegas I know lots of great places to eat for cheap. Most people don't know that you don't need to go far from the strip to get good food at an affordable price. They're just so used to buying the over inflated prices the hotels and strip restaurants charge knowing people will pay it. I used to stay at Wild Wild West until Days Inn took over, now I stay here.
I am giving the Feast buffet 3 stars not because of the excellence of the food, but  because it's so cheap. The food is acceptable for the money you pay.

It's been years , but tonight I got lured out by the Grand Opening of CulichiTown, a Sinaloa-ense , well Culichi ( term for all things from Culiacan, the Northern City ) including Culichi food, music, and hospitality. There are all the traditional sushi favorites , and fresh seafood , which is quite different from traditional Mexican , PLUS antojitos ( empanadas de camarones , and the langostinos, which are rather hard for me to find here) They have Banda and Norte√±o music with live performers playing intermittently through dinner . The bar has a really cool overhead conveyer built of different tequilas rotating around the lounge and part of the restaurant. Give it a shot ! Unique Regional food, with a hint of Asia and the absolute freshest seafood as the main ingredients is the best way to explain it. It's lighter , fresher , and more flavorful than other parts of MX. Plus they make their own tortillas!!!!!

We only come here for Bingo since it's where my MIL plays.  Free soft drinks & water inside for bingo players.  Good price, fast play and great if you win.

The slots aren't as great and the place is just dim and kinda dirty.
Chicken was dry. Not a large amount of food, the sauce for spaghetti and meatballs was not good either nor was there meatballs. We wait 10 mins for waiter to get refill.

I'm in the lobby and still unable to check in after sitting for 1 hour. The manger was in a meeting till finally he came out and talking about freaking company policy because I'm 21. I'm only 20 and I never had this problem with any other property of stations. Priceline is arguing with these shitholes right now. We are getting nowhere.

I will never spend a dime with station casinos nor my family & friends.
Las Vegas would be better with out you!! Never post on yelp but this place has the  worst service ever!! Then I complain and the sever is rude! Ok won't be back don't support them they don't you!!!

So where do I begin... I wanted to surprise my wife tonight, so I called to book a room. I usually play paigow here and just wanted to get away from home, so I figured this would be a quick get away.

1) I called around 5pm or so to book the room. The lady on the phone asked me if I wanted a king. She also said that I couldn't cancel because it was same day. No problem. I said yes, because that's what I wanted. 

2) She tells me how much it is, and after fees, its just under $100 for the night. No problem, I booked the room.

3) I get there and there are 3 people in front of me, then three more people show up after me and only 1 register open, so I wait almost 30 minutes to check in. Even the people behind me were complaining and I'd been there twice as long as them.

4) I finally get to the counter around 6:20pm and the lady tells me they don't have any kings available and haven't since yesterday. That pisses me off because the lady on the phone told me I was good for a king. Then the lady says that the king is only a "request"... well don't bill my card for a king if its only a request. Say that up front instead of lying to the customer and STEALING their money.

5) So now I can't cancel and we're stuck with a crappy room with 2 full beds instead of a king, like I was told I would have.

Avoid this place. They are liars. Any time you don't disclose that the customer may not actually get what they think they are paying for, it is dishonest. 

On top of that, they have the worst buffet in Vegas. I wouldn't even use my comps to eat there. I'm thoroughly pissed off right now because I'd much rather go somewhere else and actually get what I pay for.

FYI, according to the lady at the counter, they only have 10 kings in the entire hotel,  but you don't find that out until after they lie to you and steal your money.

I booked my stay here a month in advance and the ladies who I spoke to made everything easy for me. I arrived yesterday September 28 and checking in was pleasant as well. Once I got to my room I was satisfied because they room was really nice and omg the mirror is just so beautiful lol I would notice that all I thought was I can't wait to take pictures with my girly self , of course I loved it I honestly wanna take home with me to California lol but anyways everything was clean and put together. The only thing I will point out is the bathroom is small that the door will hit the towel. But it's ok. I had a chance to walk around they have a casino and things for kids like ice skating arena and a mini arcade room. And a pool which my daughter loved. They had plenty of restaurant inside as well we stopped by a buffet . And we loved the variety . And the decor is absolutely beautiful. Food was great. Everything so much better in person . Overall I would book here again

I'm giving this three stars because it's exactly what I expected. Nothing special, just an inexpensive place to rest my head. I was however pleasantly surprised with the free wi-fi in my room. I was able to work in the morning while my husband and son slept. Great bonus. This justifies the third star. The bed is a lot more comfortable than I expected and the room was clean and cozy. I would stay here again just so we can save money and spend it elsewhere!

Unappealing -- After a evening was spent at this 'Buffet' i was seriously dissapointed at the lack of variety and the poor quality of food. Under the 'Asian' section you will find microwaveable rice and sweet & sour chicken even the wonton soup appeared to be from a can. Out of 3 plates we had i would say the tastiest of them all was the Mexican enchiladas and the 'pork'. Other than that everything was really lacking in flavor, I feel bad for the folks who pay full price; I took advantage of the boarding pass discount and the 2-for-1 coupons. 

I don't think i'll ever be checking out this place ever again, Even with a BOGO coupon its still not worth it. This food is borderline school cafeteria quality and the dinner rolls have been left out for hours with flies all over them etc. I wont be visiting this place again any time soon.
This is the best and cheapest food for a lower style hotel. $7 bucks for a lunch Buffett which includes food such as Italian, Chinese, Mexican, and American

Had dinner at the restaurant Culici Town. This was the worst restaurant experience I have ever had. Myself and a group of people got together for a celebration. While dining in the establishment it took 20 minutes to get our first drink order. When we placed our order for food we received a portion of what we had ordered. The food was not good at all. The chicken nuggets arrived soggy and full of grease and everything else was cold. When we asked to speak to the manager it took 15 minutes for him to arrive, he stopped and spoke to the people next to us and proceeded to walk away. My husband to hail him down and ask him to come back. We informed him of the issues and he said he would look into it. 30 minutes later he nor our waiter returned.  People from our party started to leave and we had not received a bill yet. After someone hunted the manager down again he arrived with the bill, stated that he could not locate our waiter and advised us he had taken 20% off. After careful calculation we realized we had been charged for food and drinks we never received and that issue to another 20 minutes to clear up. 

Outside of the service issue there were a couple of other problems. The establishment has a live band that plays Banda music. The musicians go out into the crowd, sing to people, and take special request. They refused to pay any attention to me when My husband requested a song but when the table next to us made the same request they played it. I am not sure if the issue was they did not understand his Spanish or maybe it was the color of his skin. Let me make something clear Hispanics come in all shades of the rainbow and apparently so does ignorance. I recorded a video of him and the way the musician turned his back on him when he made the request. 

The other issue I had with this establishment was while attempting to take care of the billing situation at the register the manager was to busy eating Ramens  he got from another establishment to assist the young lady in correcting the errors on our bill. The reason I know this is because he sat out in the open eating them with a couple of his friends. I don't know about some people but I am a little turned off when individuals that work at an eating establishment don't eat their own food or they eat food from somewhere else out in the public eye. 

Maybe this establishment does not care about making themselves or the casino money an the community they do business in. From what I have read and heard throughout the casino there seems to be a general theme of horrible service. 

If it were not for the fact that this establishment is located in a casino and the consequence of getting black listed from all of their sister casinos we would have all walked out and not paid the bill.

The only thing I like about this casino is the Sobe Ice Rink thats attached to it. 

If you live in east vegas, it sucks because you have to drive quite a distance to get to it. the other ice rink in henderson sucks, its too small

The sister casino, Fiesta Henderson? ha no comment.

I am at your bingo hall and have to giveva kudos to Cathie W., one of your bingo attendants. I am here celebrating my birthday and she was as sweet as can be even though i only got the free stuff. It is awesome staff like her that keeps me wanting to come back here for bingo!

As a local I love this place!!  The staff (of the casino) is very generous!  They truly do love locals. Other than a few select staff members at Denny's; I've had minimal problem anywhere in the hotel. I personally enjoy the bingo hall there (could stand to win more). There are many gaming options in the casino. The food options are not bad. They have Panda Express, their buffet is pretty good - especially the Mongolian BBQ - prices are reasonable, Subway is by the ice arena, their Mexican restaurant Gardunos is pretty amazing and next door they have a bar called Blue Agave with great happy hour specials and don't miss out on the delicious Coconut Margarita!!!!  There is also a Denny's in the hotel and I've had minimal problems with the regular staff, it's the graveyard shift you should be weary of. They are rude, disrespectful, and obnoxious. 

The staff of the hotel and casino treats everyone kindly and the players card has many awesome incentives. 

The bingo staff is friendly and personable and at times have felt kind of like family. 

I would give them 5 stars but deducted a star because of the Denny experience.

Came here with my family for a Sunday brunch and it was pretty nice. Our waiter was the most attentive person ever. He keep all our drinks filled and even joked with my in laws. I do admit that there's not much of a selection but we had such a good time. I would definitely recommend to use the make it yourself grill. It was fun and delicious!

Received an offer I couldn't refuse. Free rooms and freeplay!

I was surprised to see how much this place has changed and for the better.

The addition of the drive up sportsbook and new Sinaloan Style restaurant were a plus.  

First off the casino and lobby have been refreshed.  New carpet, wood floors and paint. Also the ventilation was updated.  

The casino floor seems to have a more open layout.

Now to the room. 

Let me say the addition of new ac unit, furnishings, paint and a flat screen tv were very impressive.  The last time I stayed here I felt uneasy seeing a tube tv.  Though the room is still small it is comfortable and clean. 

The casino staff as well as room service were courteous and welcoming.

Not being far from the strip, this is an absolute value play.  

If all you need is a clean place to sleep for a few hours and take a shower, this is a great alternative to the strip hotels. 

The ease of getting in and out of the hotel is another advantage. 

I will never hesitate to stay and play here again. 

Based on my recent visit I'll probably qualify for another free stay and additional freeplay... I'm actually looking forward to it!

I came here from out of town to attend a family wedding. My wife and her family also stayed here. The hotel rooms were decent. The casino had a huge slots selection. I'm not a big slots fan; I prefer 21. But I looked in vain for a $1 minimum bet table. $5 was the lowest. Margaritas run $1-$3 for guests. They're huge (IMO). The buffet was good and reasonably priced.

My biggest gripe with this hotel (and the reason I only gave it 2 stars) is the extreme incompetence of the woman at the front desk. When I tried to check my father in law and my sister in law in to their room, the person at the desk couldn't find their reservation because she was looking for it using my father in law's FIRST name instead of his last name. She claimed his CA drivers license confused her. It wasn't until I demanded the manager that I was able to clear things up. We wasted 30 minutes with that ordeal (on top of the fact that we were tired from our 3 hour drive from CA)

We will never stay there again.

Dare I say the hotel is ... kinda cute? Yeah, it's obviously a budget property, with some signs like worn carpet and etc. ... but the rooms were actually nicer than I was expecting based on the unenthusiastic reviews here and elsewhere. Everything done in a bit of a Mexican villa style. You need a room key to get through a door to get into the hotel area after hours.

Re: thin walls mentioned in other reviews, I was also surprised here. I ended up with a two-bed room since that was all they had, through the bed wall I heard nothing but a faint baby squall here and there ... but when I walked by that room's door en route to the elevator I could clearly hear two older kids being rambunctious as hell in there with the TV cranked up! Wasn't making it through the wall. And that was the thinner wall, each room has one of those and then cinder blocks opposite it which are more substantial. 

The only downsides that dock a star - the wifi flat didn't work (connects but went nowhere) and no mini-fridge in the room. Plus the shower was a little goofy. 

Decent location for budget food. Buffet on site is inexpensive, though unlike other Station properties it is NOT open for breakfast. Panda Express that charges about 50 cents more than normal but is right next to the hotel area for super convenience. Also a BBQ joint that I really wanted to try, but when I stopped by at 11:15 after checking out they were still not yet ready to rock. Outside there's a Terrible's with crazy low prices on many things, Del Taco and a Walmart Supercenter within a quick walk. 

I'd go back. Get the wifi working and I'd give it an extra star.

A haiku for the buffet inside this smoke-infested retirement home disguised as a casino littered with gambling addicts: 


Save yourself the time

Explosive Diarrhea 

Combined with mudd-butt

I'm a fan of the station/fiesta casinos for locals. I think they are a great way to indulge in Sin City while staying grounded.

I went here for the buffet last, but I've also gambled here which I do like as well.

Buffet:

They have a variety of food.- good food. The enchiladas are AMAZING. They also have a Mediterranean stations where you can pick out different veggies and meats for a customer stir fry type of meal. It's fabulous! 

The desserts weren't that awesome, but I was pretty full from the food, so I won't complain. You can also get $1 margarita upon entering the buffet! It's not weak either - I was feeling it after one.

Best part - It's only $4.99 with the players card!

Hungry??? GO!

Even though this Fiesta is a bit of a trek for me, I find it to be a nice, comfortable and friendly spot to spend some time.  Staff is nice, choices in venues are varied and serviceable and general vibe is quite friendly and easygoing.  Definitely a place worth going for some casual locals time, grabbing a simple margarita, etc...

WOW! If there was a NO STAR option, I'm in! What a joke! I have been a Station customer for 17 years, Fiesta usually isn't my thing. I now now why. The people here HATE your business! That is that! They act as if they could care less you are there, I could only laugh and leave...Melvin (the gentleman in charge) was particularly clueless, the pit boss on at the time (Tim) was out of a Ron Burgandy skit, except a complete d'bag! Guess this is where the first time Station employees go...smh...no more Fiesta!

Racist!!!! This place well the club os racist to all Non-Latino people. Do not Go!! Very unfair. Not right, my friends got mistreated...what coincidence that the only 2 white people of my group were told they could not come in because of looking drunk. Terrible!!! Not a friendly place to be....i just could not wait to go back to our hotel. Even if we got a $300 VIP table and treated this way...no way.

What is (or is not) happening to the Fiesta Rancho Casino?  Is there some new management??We are locals who are at this casino usually a couple times a week.  In the last several months we have notices a lot of little changes that are not positive.  I feel that this property is and has been ignored, and funds spent have been funneled into the newer acquisitions.  The buffet has shown major decline in the last year or so.  The selections have gone from pretty good for the price,to not so hot.  Things like Cholula and jelly are not unavailable.  Meatloaf used to be a staple and now is gone etc etc.  The main reason we continue to frequent this casino is the employees.  We are on a first name basis with the valets,buffet servers and cashiers, and cafe waitresses.  I  understand budgets etc,, but for another dollar or two a much better buffet can be found very near.

Fiesta Rancho is a dive, no question about it. But that isn't necessarily a bad thing, depending on the mood you are in. There are many wonderful attributes that Fiesta Rancho has that simply cannot be found elsewhere. The value that the casino offers is second to none when it comes to prices of the buffet, limit table games, and rarified classics such as ALL PAPER Bingo. The clientele is older, lower middle class locals and a few stereotypical degenerates that find Texas Station to be too high falootin'. It is a poor man's Station Casino, that's for sure, but that doesn'tmean it should be avoided. Quite the opposite, actually. 

Occasionally when I'm driving home from a late night playing cards on the Strip, I'll stop by Fiesta Rancho just to throw some dice or play some 21. Their crap table is often just run by the dealers. No box man, and half of the table is closed. The limits are $3 with 10x odds, which puts them better than most Strip casinos that usually offer 3x4x5x odds. The place is rarely crowded and the atmosphere is casual, smoky, degeneracy laden, and fun. 

The buffet offers a great value, especially if you have kids. Though the prices have been raised, lunch is still right around $6. No breakfast is offered. Dinner is $7 or $8 and included a pretty good selection of somewhat flavorful Mongolian, American, and Mexican choices plus pizza and pasta (I hesitate to truly call it "Italian")

The casino offers an ice skating rink (random, I realize) and a small sports book. 

Overall, I do recommend Fiesta Rancho for those wanting a divey local's casino that is world's above Poker Palace but light years below Red Rock.

Let's just say my siesta at the fiesta was amazing! 

I was in heaven sleeping in that nice big comfy king size bed!  Ah...I have so many good things to say about this place, just wait! 

1) Loved the fact that check-in was incredibly simple (I used the Hotels app on my phone to book one day in advanced).  I gave my name, ID and she found me and already had my room keys set aside.  **One thing to remember is that no matter whether you're a local or not, you have to put a $100.00 deposit down, don't forget!  

2) The room was nice and clean, plenty of towels, face cloths, soap and shampoo

3) The AC unit was a traditional unit but was controlled from the wall, AWESOME feature- it got really cold fast too, just how I  like it!

4) The bed didn't come with a bagillion covers like some hotels do, it had the sheet and nice thick duvet on top, lovvvvvved that

5) There was free wifi access and a cord as well to plug in (which saved the day when we had a storm)

6) Plenty of lighting and a nice big window to let in plenty of sunshine

7) Newspaper every morning when I woke up to leave for work, kudos!

8) I almost forgot to mention! For the shower lovers out there who just have to have the right pressure- well, LOOK NO FURTHER! This is the BEST hotel shower I have ever used, I mean EVER! You can control the pressure, and the heat is incredible! I even shut the door turned it to max and enjoyed a 'sauna-like' environment for 20 minutes

Please note that there is a $11 and change charge each day (resort fee) which includes things such as # 5 & #7, but seriously the room was only $19.79 a night so were talking like $30 and I got all this awesomeness!  Even though it wasn't a Wynn or Bellagio, it was fantastic for the price and just what I was looking for! 

For TV fanatics, note that the TV is just a standard tube 32incher, BUT it comes with movies still in theatres, a selection of your preference of 'out of theaters' Thriller, Comedy, etc. and for the more risky lovers, they have lots of adult channels; straight, bi, gay, lesbian- whatever your preference you have it! 

The casino itself was nice, great size and offered quite a few places to eat.  Check out Gurdanos! And heck smash burger too, they were all wonderful! 

The absolute only thing that I can say about this visit where I had to call the front desk was in regards to the ice machine.  It was not working, but I called them and they had it fixed within 48 hours.  It's not bad enough to knock off a star, so Fiesta gets 5 stars in my book!
You're not going back up! I don't think so! I'll bust all your teeth up! Screwing me over like that!

I see a lot of bad reviews on here, but really Fiesta isn't bad. We stay here when we come to visit my father in law. It isn't the Bellagio, but for the money you really can't complain!!! 

Bonus - The tables are affordable and the payout is pretty good if you like gambling. The dealers are also really friendly. If you've never gambled before, I'd recommend going early in the morning and the dealers are friendly enough to teach you the basics.

Went to the Fiesta Rancho today for a business meeting at the Club Tequila.  The place is located right next to another Station Casino property by the name of "Texas Station".  The pro's of Fiesta are the Garduno's Mexican restaurant that has always been a good chain in town.  The Club Tequila that I visited today seemed like a great concert/club venue during the night hours.  They also feature the Ice arena for the UNLV hockey home games, which I find cool.  

Overall, I think the Fiesta has a few extras that Texas Station lacks, and lack a few qualities the Texas delivers restaurant and overall look wise.  However, if your on Rancho and looking for a little old school Casino fare don't be afraid to try Fiesta.

The Mongolian Grill at the Buffet is ONLY good if ROMERO is there.  Any other chef is lazy sloppy and makes uninspired food. but Romero takes his time and is a show within himself when he prepares your dish. He is polite debonair and I want to bring him home. Thanks for a wonderful dish tonight, Mr. Romero the Mongolian Grill Chef

If I could do -stars, I'd give this place a -5. No bellhop no coffee or bottled water in the room. No exhaust fan or heating in the bathroom. Room is dirty, the bathroom sink pipes gurgle when water goes down & green moss surrounds the on/off knob. 

Pool is empty & no one knows if it will be refilled. 

No housecleaning after check-in. Only one person at registration during day & night. No room service. 

Employees have no answers and most of them were rude. The house cleaner & yes there is only one. She was the only employee who was nice & helpful. 

If you can stay someplace else to it DON'T STAY HERE!!!!! Especially if you are disabled in any way and need help like me. You won't get any help.

Yea, okay, this place is a shithole and it's super smoky.  Whatever, it's an older casino and that's to be expected.  I'm not expecting to get a Four Seasons experience at the Fiesta Rancho.  It's close to home and I LOVE LOVE LOVE their all paper bingo.  I may be an addict.  I play at least once a week.  Cheap entertainment and a more level playing field since people don't have machines with 3754903874593 cards in them.  My only gripe is that the cocktail lady comes around after the games start and usually you don't get your drinks til halfway through the last game.  There's gotta be a more efficient way.  All in all, yea, the place is ghetto but the parking is close, staff is nice and it's a convenient neighborhood casino.

on Veterans Day weekend I came to eat the buffet with my family (party of 6) , one the hostess was overheard saying by one of my daughters " these people should eat somewhere else", ...really?, don't want to play the race card out here but maybe she was just having a bad day? maybe we should tan a bit more...or less.. not quite sure...as a veteran of this country I think it was a bit uncalled for, but that's just my opinion...last trip here, foods great but not now, not ever...
truly disappointed ... not worth the one star at all, if you're thinking of taking a taxi from the strip here I wouldn't bother, why pay a 50.00 dollar cab ride when you can stay downtown at freemont at a third of the cost.

I was playing in a hockey tournament that gave your team preferred times and rink choice if you stayed at the hotel, plus it was the cheapest of the three tournament hotels. I should have known something was up, when one of the major cross streets was Martin Luther King Jr. Blvd. (if you do not know what I mean, go watch videos of Chris Rock). Saying the area was not the best is an understatement. The hotel and clientele reflect this. I respect the fact that it is a "Locals" hotel and Casino, but so is the Orleans and Terrible's off the strip. The hotel check in is fairly hidden in a small alcove, and the casino is fairly smoky. 

THE ROOM- well what can I say, 2 beds, a shower and a tub, and a basic TV. They say they have wireless, but in a 3 night stay, the first 2 nights they had to come and reset the access point. The last time they did this, they said the access point in our room was broken, so we did not have WiFi, but they were "nice" enough to loan us an ethernet cable. The speed is terrible, and do not even try to stream a video with their network. 

Casino- Fair at best. Few blackjack tables, and if you think other sports are better than basketball, stay away. When I was placing some bets on hockey games, people in line were yelling to hurry up, even though there were no other open windows. (I was up there for less than 2 minutes)

FOOD- when one of the fancy sit down restaurants is a DENNYS, you know you are in trouble. 

I value my safety and life, so I will be staying away from this place like the plague.

This Casino, which looks very old, probably seen better days. 

Usually I would come here to eat breakfast at Denny's. But looking at Fiesta overall, I would not stay here, even if they gave me a free room. But I'll give credit where credit is due. 

The gift shop, is small, but the lady behind the counter was nice and concerned, that I wasn't feeling to well, when I was buying a few Advil's and bottle of water. It did put a smile on my face when I left. Denny's has its ups and downs, in which, I like going to Denny's before 6am, if possible, the service seems to be nice before 6, after 6am, service kind of sucks. 

I think I gamble there probably twice, and both time I lost. The dealers there, would not talk to me much, not unless you tipped them, then they'll say "Thank You". Any other time, they'll probably glare at you for placing a bet. Being a dealer myself, I learned to interact with people, regardless if they tip or not.  Seeing dealers who don't say a thing, makes me wonder, why they even became a dealer and how do they make tips, if their not interacting.  

Over all, I probably would suggest to stay away from Fiesta as much as you can. But if you have too, do not gamble, and just eat there. Denny's food was good, but service sucks after 6am, but if you don't mind the service, then go for it.

WORST PLACE EVER. My girlfriend and I stayed here because we thought it would be super cheap. There are several hidden fees and at the end of the day, if we would have paid a tiny bit more, we could have stayed at a WAAAAAAY better place. Trust me.

$3 table is obviously rigged. It always gives dealer 20's or convenient one more than you on the table. Dealer rarely busts making the Bust It game pointless. Table only ever gives money to one in three people playing at the table, otherwise the machine sets it up to always give dealer 20's or hardway wins in perfect basic strategy. What a scam.

A week later I decided to give this place one last chance. Maybe I got unlucky. Nope, same story. Suspicious convenient one more than you. Dealer always had nothing but 19-20 or would get a miraculous low card to keep themselves in while not paying bust side game while always giving player bust 10's. Also miraculous 5-6 card 20's and 21's. This place is a scam. Go somewhere else. 

What's even worse is they contacted me and asked for my information then proceeded to ignore me. Oh yeah really wanna keep me as a regular don't ya? Never coming back here again.

We came for the buffet at about 6:00pm on a Sunday. Regular price is only $9 and we had some two for one coupons, so the price was right  The selection was not great, but decent. They have two soft serve ice cream machines, neither of which were working. Soft serve has become a staple at almost every buffet, so this was a huge disappointment. However, it was entertaining watching people young and old attempting to get soft serve despite the "Not In Service" sign hanging on the machine. It got so bad buffet personnel had to remove all of the bowls to keep people away from the broken machine. The lowlight of the evening, though, had to be the poor eight year old boy who got sick and vomited all over the buffet floor, smack dab in the middle. Response from buffet workers to clean up the enormous amount of projectile was slow at best and there were not enough wet floor signs for proper coverage.  Chairs had to be used to keep oblivious people from strolling through the puke and spreading it through the entire buffet. We never did see a mop show up in the fifteen minutes were we there following the initial vomit. I felt really bad for the poor kid and shouldn't hold his misfortune against the buffet. We will probably be back someday, but I need some time for this memory to fade.

The price of their buffet can't be beat. The food selections may not be as much as the other buffets, but the food they do have is very good. They have a Mongolian station where customers can select their own ingredients and the hamburgers are made to order. The wait to be seated is short and the service most of the time is very good.

This place was HORRIBLE!!! I thought staying at circus circus was going to be bad. F*CK NO!!!! They make circus circus seem like a 5 star resort. We stayed here because we went to their empty club (got dragged into it by a friend) and didn't want to have to drive anywhere else so we ended up staying here. The club didn't have a restroom inside (weird af and inconvenient!) So our drunk asses had to walk through the grimy casino to get to the restroom, hoping we didn't get robbed on the way! I could go on and on about this place, but I'd rather not. They definitely need to put some money into this place and maybe attract a different crowd here.

My fiance & I went in to check on hotel rates for people coming to our wedding from out of town. There was a Be Right Back sign on the hotel registration desk. We stood there for about 10 min before a lady came over & said they will be with us in a moment. So, finally a clerk comes out and just looks at me. She says "Checking in?" & I replied "No", so then she says "Checking out?", and again I said "No". She let me know she was just coming on shift & had to set up the computer, etc. So we waited some more & then I asked for a manager. The lady that was in the back was now walking by & said she was the manager. I pointed out that ignoring customers is probably not the best way to get business & she just wanted to argue about what took place. 
That horrible first impression cost them a lot of money.

If I could give this place ZERO stars I would. Horrible service, horrible mean cocktail waitresses &  bartenders.
Don't waste your time & money go to boulder station
I do like the Mongolian BBQ at the Buffet and Gardunos.   A lot of good food for a fair price.

I remember when this place was pretty cool.  When it opened in 1994 it changed the game for local casinos.  It was once known as the "Royal Flush Capital of the World".  The Buffet attracted tons of people from all over the Vegas Valley and it was hopping every night.  That was when the Maloof's owned the joint.  

Fast forward 17 yrs later......now this place is a shell of it's former self.  I walked into this place a couple of weeks ago and it hasn't aged well.  The vibe it once had.....gone.  The excitement at the slots and table games....gone.  The happy employees.....gone.

My desire to return to this place.....gone.

Return Factor - 5%

I didn't really enjoy my experience at Fiesta Rancho because it seems as though the materials and rooms are older. 

They also don't really offer any really good restaurants. They are average, but priced affordably. 

The elevator basically solidified the quality of this place. It's one of those where you are nervous to enter it because it looks like it needed some fixing!

The bed was good. The towels were fluffy. There were flat panel TVs. Water pressure in the shower was good. That's about all I can say that is good. Very small bathrooms, where you can't be sitting on the toilet and close the door at the same time. No in-room coffee, no fridge. I didn't notice it in our room, but the smoke really bothered my husband. He felt like it wafted up through the floor. 4th floor was non smoking, but I suspect the 3rd floor is a smoking floor.  Also, my son complained multiple times about the cooling system; he claimed it was loud and sounded like "a plastic bag flapping in the wind." The food at Denny's inside was pretty bad, even for Denny's standards.  The fiesta buffet was pretty good, but few healthy options (probably the norm among buffets). The Mexican restaurant was good but pricey. We will not be returning.
Used to be a great plan to come. Now too many rule changes and restrictions. I will be looking for a new local place to go to. It's a sad day.

My two closest casinos - just a hop, skip and a jump away on the other side of the North Las Vegas Airport - are this Fiesta (the original Fiesta opened by the Maloof family in December 1994) and Texas Station directly across Lake Mead Boulevard which made its debut in 1995.

The Fiesta is the smaller and more intimate of these two casino options. Seniors with mobility issues may have an easier time getting around here due the more compact floorplan and convenient arrangement of all the pertinent attractions.

The Fiesta has one of the most reasonably priced buffets in the Las Vegas metropolitan area and is always worth a visit with it's plentiful variety of food attractively presented at six cooking stations and multiple international cuisines.

A coffee shop and a Denny's are also located on the premises. The usual casino table games and a plethora of one-armed bandits/poker machines are available whenever your itch to gamble needs scratching. 

Diverse contests and promotions are always underway throughout the year, especially now that the Fiesta is owned by Station Casinos.

Be sure to stop on by whenever you find yourself in the badlands of North Las Vegas.

I used to come to the Fiesta Rancho in the past but with the building of casinos closer to where I live, the Fiesta became less of an option.

I came here to have dinner at Gardu√±os and I stayed to play some slots after dinner. The casino is on the small side but it is pleasant.  It's a typical locals casino.  

If you have the desire, there is an ice skating rink.

All in all, an OK place but a drive for me to get to.

Since the last time that I been here it was pretty poor. They picked it up quickly and I realize that the food is being served hot and fresh. I'll come here every once in a while. Maybe I'll stop by and grab some food and check to see if my girlfriend is there. She's not actually my girlfriend, but I just wanna see her cute little butt.. Their buffet needs a little more improvement and a bigger variety.

This place made me feel like I smoked two packs a day while just passing through. The air is so thick you can actually see it. The clientele didn't inspire much confidence either. I felt like a victim-waiting-to-happen.

Last resort to stay here, as it was the NCAA championship games weekend, so all the prices for the fancier hotels on the strip were extremely overpriced.  This hotel is old.  Our non smoking room still smells of cigarette smoke.  No free breakfast, fridge or microwave.  (I've received better value at a Comfort Inn which includes the previous 3 items)

Pros: really friendly staff.

This is one of our favorite local casinos! My husband and I had a staycation for the weekend! The room was standard, but just perfect for our short get away. The service was excellent. Every weekend they have a live band which is always "amazing!" So, it makes it easier and safer to have a few extra drinks and jump on the elevator and crash!  The buffet is very good. It takes you around the world Mexican, American, Italian, huge salad bar, sugar free desserts.I love the whole experience and highly recommend this business. I will also say I have never experienced any racist attitudes!

Eh frfr, this is the Low-Key hang out spot on Friday Night.  Around the corner is the Mexican restaurant but this is not about that restaurant...another day for that, it is GOOD.  I can't think of the name of the place, but there is a lounge that has a band that play on Friday night.  I personally go for the cheap drinks, but now I go for the PEOPLE WATCHING.  You really get to see locals get down on a Friday night.  

So the lounge has a cool little band that play, kind of has the feel of 'Phil Flowers-esque'.  Ol' skool music, a place where you won't find to many young ppl, no 30 and under crowd over here.  I will be 38 yrs old Labor day, hell I felt like a baby sitting up in there.  This is the place that you would bump into your PLAYA-RIFIC Old Ass Uncle and his friends, still talking about how they use to get down back in the day.  Yes indeed, CATDADDY's and COUGARS on the prowl, and me and my friends looking like fresh fish off the line.  

Cheap drinks, yes they serve the $0.99 margarita, my drinks of choice for that evening was Bud Light (bottled) and Crown on the rocks $13 total.  This is going to be my secret hideout, no need to get all fancy, just some chucks, shorts and a tshirt.  Don't go in there looking crazy, do your hair at least, all I'm saying is that you can go hang out on a super casual status.

A FRIENDLY NOTE: note to da ladies, gear up...I said CATDADDY's and yes on da PROWL.  They come at you at every angle, be prepared.  You've been WARNED.  Sorry, I'm just being honest, you better get your catdaddy's lingo up.  :-)

But this is just my opinion....hahahaha ahahahah I'm over here in tears cracking up, reading this...but it's true

Royal flush Capitol of the world my ass. The machines are tight. The clientele is scary. I was constantly looking over my shoulder. I felt so uncomfortable here that a future visit is highly unlikely.

This is a review for the hotel only. I didn't visit the casino.

The reservation desk was speedy and moderately friendly.

A key card was required to access the tower with the rooms. I was waiting in the lobby and I saw A LOT of people having trouble getting their key to work. I had trouble getting my key to work. There's a problem with their key reader that makes it fussy.

The elevator going up to the room was run down and trashy looking. I didn't have high hopes for the room. Much to my surprise the room was nicely decorated and clean. The bathroom was "economy" in its styling but, hey, I only paid $28 (total) for the room!!! It was a smokin' deal!!!

Overall, I'd give them a higher rating if they worked a little harder around their rough edges.

Another stop on my off strip casino tour.  This is an older casino with a large attached parking structure.  I was surprised to find a Hockey ring here.  It kind of reminds me of the casinos along Fremont before they cleaned them up a bit.  Place looks a little old but it seemed to be pretty busy with a lot of locals.

I would think twice before staying in the hotel.  It's cheap, but I'm not sure that makes it worth it to stay here.

The front desk staff was useless.  I was only waiting behind one family, but it took FOREVER to get checked in.  One receptionist was hopelessly trying to help the family, and the other one was just sitting there doing nothing.  I understand sometimes that there's a wait, but neither one of them said "I'll be with you in a moment", or "I'm sorry, I'm in training (or whatever) and she'll help you in a moment", or anything remotely useful.  When I got helped, not only did I not get an apology for the wait, but the receptionist was rude and brusk.

The key reader to get into the hotel tower didn't work 80% of the time, regardless of the key.  I saw quite a few people struggling with it.

We had booked a room with a king bed, but they gave us a room with two doubles.  We were only there for one night, so we just put up with it because there was no way we were going to try and deal with the front desk again.

The room was clean, but very basic, almost to the point of being prison-like.  If you like staring at cinder block walls, you will love the decor here.  The walls and doors are paper-thin, to the point of being nearly able to hear conversations in the next room.  You could definitely clearly hear conversations people were having in the hallway.  It's the kind of place where you worry that people will hear what you're doing.  The clientele was a bit sketchy since it's a cheap place, but the place was well-lit and had security everywhere.

The casino was fine, they had cheap video poker with decent odds.  I sat at the bar and got a ton of free drinks, which made the whole experience easier.

Not in a good area, and it does have a bad smoke smell to the casino.The buffet has made my husband sick several times we don't eat at any restaurants in Fiesta, but if you wanted to eat there; think the Mexican restaurant  is reasonable. it is a ghetto casino I see more low lives druggy people. And slots suck not much play back just like Wildfire. I prefer to play at Texas Station won more

We checked in yesterday and chose the Fiesta Rancho because we are here for a hockey camp that is held in the hotel's ice arena. I was a bit worried after reading other reviews that said it was smoky and dirty. I was happily surprised. I've stayed at the Venetian and New York New York and this casino is not much smoker than those. It definitely seems to have a ventilation system.  I have never smoked and am sensitive to smoke but honestly it's fine. It is a casino after all!  The staff has been very friendly and helpful. I was playing a machine and noticed staff going around cleaning, straightening chairs.  The rink isn't too cold for spectators, even in summer clothes.

Food: my teenager is happy that there is a SubWay, Panda Express, and Denny's right inside the hotel/casino. We had a nice Mexican dinner at a Mexican restaurant in the casino last night with yummy coconut margaritas. They put toasted coconut around the rim with honey.  We haven't tried the buffet. They have Italian, Mongolian, not sure what else.

Cleanliness: like I say, they're cleaning a lot in the casino. My room smelled very clean, even a little bleachy when we arrived. The shower is a little worn, but I don't care. They have a non-smoking area of the casino. No tables in that section, just machines. Public bathrooms in the casino are large, modern (lots of tile), and very clean. The carpet in the Denny's is a bit trashed looking but the Denny's is otherwise clean. They decorate a lot and have left lots of adhesive stuff on the walls. Weird, but not an issue.

Room: clean, basic. No microwave, coffee pot, or fridge. They do have wall outlets handy, which is sometimes not so even in more expensive hotels. I have a view of a parking lot, abandoned drive-in and a billboard advertising a Hawaiian buffet. No free Wi-Fi. I think it's $6 for 24hrs. I'm using the hot spot on my phone. No conditioner.  Newer, up-to-date bedding. Air conditioner works great. Plenty cool in there.

Location: 22 min North from McCarren Airport  on MapQuest.  10min North of Downtown/Fremont Street Experience.  Next to Texas Station, same property owner. Texas Station has a bowling alley, theatre, Starbucks.  People say their buffet is good.

Transportation: taxis on site. We took the 106 bus from a bus stop across the street and rode 20min south to Downtown last night to go to the Fremont Street Experience. The bus was running every 30min. $2 for single trip. $3 for 2-hr pass. $5 all day. There is a 24-hr "Deuce" shuttle between Downtown and the Strip. It's over 100 degrees, so it was hot waiting but there is a small bus shelter. Not bad.

Pool: basic, small, clean.  Clean towels provided poolside but no food, drinks, or dressing area.

Casino: a few card tables, lots of  machines, a Keno runner circulating at least thru Denny's, a Keno machine area, several bars, a large Bingo hall.  I had an issue with my machine so lit the call button. The guy was there in about 10seconds to re-boot it. Very friendly. There's a bar in the center of the casino; not walled in.

This is not as upscale as properties on the strip, but it's not on the strip.  Smoky? Yeah, but not bad. I would come back!

-AC

First of all, I live near this place. Also, I'm cheap and dislike driving long distances. So living close to a place that sells $1 margaritas automatically puts this place up in three-star range for me. What makes it a four, you ask?

First of all, this place is for locals. No doubt about it. This place has deals all the time, and the Latin club inside this place isn't bad at all for the area it's in. It's actually pretty cool. I usually just come here for the drinks and occasional meal at Panda Express, so I don't know how good the hotel portion of this place is. I assume it's also no-frills, though.

All in all, this place is alright. It's cheap, it's close to my house, and it caters to my demographic. I'll be here time and time again.
We dined at Fiesta Rancho Buffet.  Service as always was excellant!  Hubby was happy!

The Martini Bar bartender may need a refresher course on how to make an old fashioned. My husband ordered one and I knew immediately it was the wrong color. I am a bartender as well but I hate when other bartenders try and tell me how to make a drink so I kept silent and tried a sip of his drink. It tasted like soda water. No recipe for an old fashioned requires soda water.
